"'''Old fat spider spinning in a tree!'''" is the first line of a poem written by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] that was published in ''[[The Hobbit]]'' in [[1937]].<ref name=hobbit>{{H|8}}</ref>

==First stanza==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
Old fat spider spinning in a tree!
Old fat spider can’t see me!
     Attercop! Attercop!
       Won't you stop,
Stop your spinning and look for me?<ref name=hobbit/></poem>

==History==
[[Bilbo Baggins]] sang this poem to distract the [[spiders]] while attempting to save [[Thorin]] and his [[Thorin and Company|companions]] in [[Mirkwood]].<ref name=hobbit/>

==Background==
Tolkien first wrote the poem on some plot notes before he subsequently made minor changes to it.<ref name=history>{{HH|PNA}}, note 15</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''1977: [[The Hobbit (1977 film)|''The Hobbit'' (1977 film)]]:'''
:Though it was omitted from the final film, a version of the song appears on [[The Hobbit: The Complete Original Soundtrack|the soundtrack]], titled "[[Old Fat Spider]]". The vocals were performed by [[Glenn Yarbrough]].

'''1985: [[The Hobbit (1985 television film)|''The Hobbit'' (1985 television film)]]'''
:The words are used by Bilbo as in the book, though without singing.
